main event: An oblong object, identified as a radiosonde balloon, was observed near Colts Neck, NJ on May 10, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a basketball and reported to be white and silver., The object was stationary, flying at an altitude between 5,000 to 10,000 feet., The sighting lasted for an extended period with observers still able to see it., A military jet identified the object during the observation., Clear weather conditions were reported at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: oblong object, identified as a radiosonde balloon
